page.title: 11RESIDENTIAL HOMES
page.content: The{Aweldeg Residential Home}was opened in 1975, to accomodate elderly people. The home can cater for 46 residents but has 42,(12 men and 30 women) at present. 22 part-time staff, supervised by the matron, run the home. Most residents are from the area around Llandysul. The more able residents, who so wish, are transported to the local churches, on Sunday, or to the Day Centre at Newcastle Emlyn during the week. They can also walk down to the village. The oldest resident this year is 102 years old. Doctors from the two local surgeries attend to all the residents at the home. Payment for staying at the home comes either from the residents own income or from the government. Relatives and friends are allowed to visit, and various organis- ations, such as the W.I.,donate gifts.
